docs.title: STAC Collection Manager
docs.text: Manage STAC collections: validate, create (convert/upload), remove and inject items.

docs.title: create — Create a new STAC collection
docs.text: Build the collection from input/<folder>, convert layers to COG, upload layers and the collection. Optionally clean local COGs after a successful upload.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• -f, --folder (required): Input folder under input/ with collection.json and layers.
  • -c, --collection (optional): Collection name. If omitted, the id in collection.json is used.
  • -o, --overwrite (optional): Overwrite existing collection if it already exists.
  • --delete-local-cog (optional): Delete local COGs in output/<folder> after a successful upload.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
sdt create -f my_folder -c MyCollection
sdt create -f my_folder --delete-local-cog

docs.title: validate — Validate a collection specification (no upload)
docs.text: Validate folder structure and collection.json schema without converting or uploading.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• -f, --folder (required): Input folder under input/ containing collection.json and layers.
  • -c, --collection (optional): Collection name to validate. If omitted, uses the id from collection.json.

docs.title: remove — Remove a collection
docs.text: Remove the indicated collection from the target storage.

docs.title: inject — Inject items into collection.json from .tif files
docs.text: Scan input/<folder> for .tif and rewrite the items array in collection.json. The rest of fields remain unchanged. Filenames must include a year (2005) or a period (2000_2005 or 2000-2005). Duplicate period/year IDs raise an error.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• -f, --folder (required): Folder under input/ with collection.json and .tif files.
  • -o, --output (optional): Optional output path for the resulting JSON (default: overwrite in place).
  • --no-backup (optional): Do not create a backup when overwriting collection.json.
